pid_data.process_description: This P&ID represents the complete operational workflow for preparing, transferring, conditioning, and delivering high-concentration hydrogen peroxide (H₂O₂) for thrust testing. The process begins at the starting point zone—the 1000-liter SUS-316 main storage tank, which is first cleaned using deionized and de-oxygenated water supplied from the 1000-L H₂O tank. It ends at the catalyst bed, the final delivery point where conditioned H₂O₂ is supplied for reaction testing. The overall operation is carried out in four phases: (Phase-1) cleaning and preparation of the main tank using DI/DO water introduced through valve V-O and drained through V-D; (Phase-2) transferring H₂O₂ from 20-liter supply barrels into the 1000-L tank via valves V-V, V-I, and the vacuum system connected through V-R; (Phase-3) distributing H₂O₂ from the main tank into three 145-liter carbon-fiber storage tanks via valve V-05 while nitrogen pressurization (60–80 barA) maintains transfer flow; and (Phase-4) delivering pressurized peroxide high-concentration H₂O from the three 145-L tanks to the catalyst bed using high-pressure nitrogen propulsion (60–80 barA) propels the peroxide through the transfer lines, Differential pressure transmitters (P6 and P7) monitor and control the flow rate, while thermometer T1 and a CO₂-based cooling system regulate temperature to protect the catalyst from overheating. Once conditioned, the peroxide enters the catalyst bed, marking the completion of the test operation.
system_outputs: Vent gas to venting desk / atmosphere

equipment.name: 1000 L H2O2 Tank
equipment.context: Main SUS-316 peroxide storage and transfer tank with load cell and safety relief set 8 bar

equipment.name: 1000 L H2O Tank
equipment.context: Deionized/de-oxygenated water tank used for cleaning and preparation of 1000 L H2O2 tank

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 1
equipment.context: First 145 L carbon-fiber peroxide storage tank with load cell, part of three-tank delivery set

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 2
equipment.context: Second 145 L carbon-fiber peroxide storage tank with load cell

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 3
equipment.context: Third 145 L carbon-fiber peroxide storage tank with load cell

equipment.name: N2 Bundle Left
equipment.context: 200 bar nitrogen bundle feeding PR-1 for pressurizing 145 L tanks

equipment.name: N2 Bundle Right
equipment.context: 200 bar nitrogen bundle feeding PR-2 for pressurizing 145 L tanks and downstream lines

equipment.name: Pressure Regulator PR-1
equipment.context: Venting pressure regulator for N2 supply to 145 L tanks group left

equipment.name: Pressure Regulator PR-2
equipment.context: Pressure regulator for N2 supply to 145 L tanks group right

equipment.name: Venting Desk
equipment.context: Common vent point for main 1000 L H2O2 tank nitrogen system

equipment.name: Vacuum Pump
equipment.context: Vacuum source connected via V-R-X and V-X for drawing H2O2 from 20 L barrels into main tank

equipment.name: Weight Scale
equipment.context: Weight scale for 20 L H2O2 barrels upstream of V-V

equipment.name: Catalyst Bed
equipment.context: Final reaction bed receiving conditioned high-concentration H2O2 for thrust testing

equipment.name: Cooling CO2 System
equipment.context: CO2-based cooling system around delivery line to control temperature before catalyst bed

equipment.name: Full Pipe Exhaust
equipment.context: Exhaust outlet for depressurizing line via V-09

equipment.name: Waste Liquid Drain
equipment.context: Waste liquid discharge point for cleaning fluids via V-D

equipment.name: N2 Cylinder Main Tank
equipment.context: Nitrogen bottle with pressure regulator used to pressurize main 1000 L H2O2 tank

utility_lines.utility_type: Nitrogen (pressurization) from right N2 bundle through PR-2

utility_lines.flow_direction: from 145 L tanks nitrogen lines toward atmosphere
